intro: Descurainia adenophora, commonly known as the bladderpod, is a flowering plant in the family Brassicaceae. It is native to North America and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnately compound leaves. The plant typically grows in dry, open habitats such as prairies and disturbed soils. It produces small, rounded seed pods that contain several seeds. Descurainia adenophora is often found in the western United States and is adapted to arid environments.
